stanza.line: Say that thou didst forsake me for some faultfault
And I will comment upon that offenceoffence
Speak of my lameness and I straight will halthalt
Against thy reasons making no defencedefence
Thou canst not (love) disgrace me half so illill
To set a form upon desired changechange
As Ill my self disgrace knowing thy willwill
I will acquaintance strangle and look strangestrange
Be absent from thy walks and in my tonguetongue
Thy sweet beloved name no more shall dwelldwell
Lest I (too much profane) should do it wronkwronk
And haply of our old acquaintance telltell
For thee against my self Ill vow debatedebate
For I must neer love him whom thou dost hatehate
